issue.title: [CF 570] Is there a way to show who cast an aura on you?
issue.body:
Question: I am trying to show who cast an aura on me (say Guardian Spirit) using the aura check.  I can get the button to pop with timer etc.  But I have not found a DogTag field that will display who "applied" the aura to me (as I see in standard aura tooltips).  I tried all the listed dog tag shortcuts Source, Destination, Unit etc. - and they all either we're empty or displayed my name.

Is there actually a way to show who applied an aura on you?
Thanks in advance.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1.
2.
3.

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
6.0.3 r567

Do you have an error log of what happened?

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)


> Posted by CurseForge user Stanoslav | Imported from CurseForge issue #570 | Raw

comments.body:
^1^T^SType^Scleu ^SSettingsPerView^T ^Sicon^T ^STexts^T ^N1^S[Source] ^t^t^t^SDestUnit^Splayer ^SCLEUEvents^T ^SSPELL_AURA_APPLIED^B ^t^SEnabled^B ^t^N60101^S`| ^Sicon^^

This will check for any buffs applied to you and type the name of the source in the icon for 5 seconds. Copy paste it into the import text field, then press "Import/Export/Restore", then select "From String", then selected "((Unnamed))".


> Posted by CurseForge user trixter21992251

Will trixter21992251's suggestion be sufficient for this? Or is something else required to provide the functionality you are looking for?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Give me a bit to test .. waiting for a priest to test this with ... and I'll report back. Definitely appreciate the help .. stand by!


> Posted by CurseForge user Stanoslav

Okay .. just tested that out. Mixed overall results... (some good .. some confusing a bit)

What I am seeing is that the "Combat Event" does indeed properly trap the "Source" name of the caster. But I noticed it does not capture the duration automatically like the buff/debuff type. I tested both approaches, Combat Event and Buff/Debuff ... displaying all variables.

Combat Event traps: Spell cast, Source, but not Duration (unless I set it) nor Extra. Buff/Debuff traps: Spell cast, Duration and Extra (via the variable text), but not caster.

SO ... if this behavior is expected / correct ... then I have to choose which works best for me. I could use "Spell:Duration" with the Combat Event approach, but only if the spell durations are not modified by talents (i.e. only if they are predictable).

So I guess my question is ... is this behavior expected or am I doing something wrong as a relatively new user?

Below is my export string (if required) ... Group 4 / Icon 1 and Group 11 / Icon 1 were my testers using a Shaman Earth Shield as the test spell.

Edited Sep 2, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Stanoslav

Well, I thought I responded with this earlier, but I guess not. Praise be https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/lazarus-form-recovery/

Here's what I wanted to say 6 hours ago:

You could also setup both, and then use [Source(group=1, icon=1):Name] as a text tag on the buff/debuff icon, where the group and icon in the tag point to the Combat Event icon that is listening for the source of the buff (make sure you change them as needed). You would probably want to set the Combat Event icon to always hide in this setup.

Edited Sep 3, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Cybeloras ... ahhh very cool. Glad that it's possible! Go ahead and close this one out. :)


> Posted by CurseForge user Stanoslav
